channel.title: Bloomberg Markets
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: Shock-Proof Oil Stocks to Weather the Geopolitical Storm
item.description: Cole Smead, Smead Capital Management, CEO & Portfolio Manager speaks with Romaine Bostick and Scarlet Fu about navigating the volatile oil market. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Obstructions Remain in Potential US-Iran Talks: Expert
item.description: Ray Takeyh, Senior Fellow at The Council on Foreign Relations speaks with Romaine Bostick and Scarlet Fu about the Israel and Iran conflict and the role the US will play. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Oklo CEO on What's Driven the Stock Up +500% in a Year
item.description: Jacob DeWitte, Oklo CEO & Co-Founder speaks with Romaine Bostick and Scarlet Fu about the success of Oklo this past year and what the future holds. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Ardian's Mark Benedetti on Democratizing PE (Correct)
item.description: Ardian Executive President Mark Benedetti discuses the democratization of private equity on "Bloomberg Open Interest." (Corrects spelling of guest's name in headline) (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Musk’s xAI Lures Investors to Sweetened $5 Billion Debt Deal
item.description: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence startup xAI Corp. lured enough investors to its $5 billion debt deal by offering sweeter pricing on Friday.
item.dc:creator: Gowri Gurumurthy, Rachel Graf

item.title: How Ice Cube's Big3 Is Changing the Game
item.description: Music Legend, Actor and Producer Ice Cube discusses how Big3, the 3-on-3 basketball league he founded, is changing the game with Romaine Bostick on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: ‘Abolishing FEMA’ Memo Outlines Ways for Trump to Scrap Agency
item.description:
A memo titled "Abolishing FEMA" outlines ways for Trump to scrap the agency.
Zahra Hirji explains how the administration aims to create a re-branded, radically smaller disaster response organization. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: CarMax Earnings Show Rise in Used Car Demand | Bloomberg Markets 6/20/2025
item.description: "Bloomberg Markets" follows the market moves across every global asset class and discusses the biggest issues for Wall Street. Today's guests; Bloomberg's Nir Kaissar, David Welch, Michelle Cortez, and Rachel Phua. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US Refining Capacity Declines Amid Uncertain Fuel Demand Outlook
item.description: US refiners’ operating capacity edged lower in 2024 as an uncertain outlook for gasoline and diesel prompted fuelmakers to pull back after a period of expansion.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Risser

item.title: S&P 500 Trading Volume Spikes at Wall Street Close: Markets Wrap
item.description: A jittery week ended with losses in stocks as investors weighed geopolitical and trade developments, chipmakers sank while a $6.5 trillion options expiration spurred a surge in volume. Short-dated yields fell as Federal Reserve’s Christopher Waller said rates could drop as early as July.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

item.title: Hedge Funds Rush Into Oil Long Bets as Mideast Conflict Grows
item.description: Hedge funds boosted their bullish position in Brent crude by the most since early October as Israel’s strikes against Iran’s nuclear program imperiled a region that produces around a third of the world’s oil.
item.dc:creator: Mia Gindis

item.title: Trump Says Iran Wants to Speak With US, Not Europe
item.description: President Donald Trump says two weeks is the maximum amount of time he will allow to pursue diplomacy with Iran while speaking with reporters. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Equities Finish Choppy Session Lower | Closing Bell
item.description: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Scarlet Fu, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Wall Street’s First-Half Whiplash Rewards All-Weather Portfolios
item.description: Somehow, for all its drama — tariffs, fiscal brinkmanship, inflation fears, and geopolitical flare-ups — the first half of 2025 may be remembered by diversified investors for something else entirely: the strongest stretch of synchronized market gains in years.
item.dc:creator: Denitsa Tsekova, Emily Graffeo

media:content.media:description: Traders on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange, on June 20.

item.title: Fed’s Daly Says Next Rate Cut More Likely in the Fall
item.description: Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco President Mary Daly said an interest-rate cut this fall looks more appropriate than moving when policymakers gather in July.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Condon

media:content.media:description: Mary Daly, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco, speaks to members of the media during the National Association of Business Economics (NABE) economic policy conference in Washington, DC, US, on Friday, Feb. 16, 2024. The theme of this year's annual meeting is Navigating Geopolitical Turbulence and Domestic Uncertainty.

item.title: Bitcoin Network Activity Slows While Price Lingers Near Highs
item.description: Once institutional investors are finally onboard has long been a rallying cry for Bitcoin enthusiasts projecting sky-high price forecasts.
item.dc:creator: Kirk Ogunrinde

media:content.media:description: A neon Bitcoin cryptocurrency logo at a crypto exchange kiosk in Warsaw.

item.title: US Stocks Extend Losing Run as Geopolitics Dampens Investor Mood
item.description: US stocks ended the week with losses as investors assessed the latest geopolitical developments and tried to determine the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate path.
item.dc:creator: Joel Leon

media:content.media:description: Governor of the US Federal Reserve Christopher Waller

item.title: Circle Gets Buy Rating After Senate Passes Stablecoin Bill
item.description: Circle Internet Group Inc.’s shares jumped 20% on Friday after Seaport Global gave the stablecoin issuer its first buy rating in the wake of the US Senate’s move this week to pass legislation setting up regulatory rules for cryptocurrencies pegged to the dollar.
item.dc:creator: Monique Mulima

media:content.media:description: Circle signage during the company's IPO on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange in New York on June 5.

item.title: Oil Drops as Trump Eases Concerns About Imminent Strike on Iran
item.description: Oil fell after President Donald Trump signaled a decision on whether to strike Iran will be made within two weeks, easing concerns about an imminent attack from the US.
item.dc:creator: Alex Longley, Mia Gindis

media:content.media:description: Oil tankers. Photographer: Patrick T. Fallon/Bloomberg

item.title: LME Sets New Rule Forcing Traders to Reduce Big Metals Bets
item.description: The London Metal Exchange has imposed a new rule to force traders to reduce large positions, after the market was rocked in recent months by the arrival of some of the world’s biggest energy traders.
item.dc:creator: Jack Farchy

media:content.media:description: Traders, brokers and clerks on the trading floor of the open outcry pit at the London Metal Exchange.

item.title: AQR’s Cliff Asness Sides With Jim Chanos in Critique of Michael Saylor’s Strategy
item.description: AQR Capital Management’s Cliff Asness says he’s in agreement with famed short seller Jim Chanos when it comes to his criticism of Strategy founder Michael Saylor’s claim that the use of convertible debt affords the leveraged Bitcoin proxy downside protection while continuing to accumulate the cryptocurrency.
item.dc:creator: Yiqin Shen

media:content.media:description: Cliff Asness, chief investment officer of AQR Capital Management LLC, during the Bloomberg Invest event in New York, US, on Tuesday, June 25, 2024. The conference invites leaders in asset management, banking, wealth, and private markets to track, dissect, and predict the future's greatest changes, risks and opportunities.

item.title: Government Contractors Recruit Fewer Prospects
item.description: Thousands of private government consultants laid off during the Trump administration’s cost-cutting crusade are increasingly flooding a shrinking labor market. Bloomberg's Rachel Phua has more on the story. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: September Is Live Meeting for Fed, Says Guggenheim's Brown
item.description: Guggenheim Fixed Income CIO Steven Brown says September will be a "live meeting" for the Federal Reserve when it decides on interest rates. He speaks on "Bloomberg Real Yield." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Fed's Next Move, Narrowing Labor Market, Inflation
item.description: Guggenheim’s Fixed Income CIO Steven Brown and Columbia Threadneedle’s Global Rates Strategist Ed Al-Hussainy discussed what and when will be Fed's next move. They flagged a slowing job market and narrowing labor cushion, warning that even slight rises in unemployment could shift the Fed’s tone — especially as more inflation and tariff data come in. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Robot Delivery Service Plans US and Europe Expansion
item.description: Coco Robotics, the maker of cooler-sized delivery robots, has raised $80 million in its latest funding round to improve the technology and expand to new cities. CEO Zach Rash discusses how the service has been performing in L.A., Helsinki, and other cities with Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: SoftBank’s Founder Pitches $1 Trillion US AI Hub
item.description: Jordan Klein, Managing Director at Mizuho Securities USA, says Masayoshi Son’s pitch for a $1 trillion AI and robotics hub in Arizona is a marketing ploy. He explains why he thinks that on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Niger Junta Seizes French Nuclear Giant Orano’s Uranium Mine
item.description: Niger’s military government took control of Orano SA’s uranium mine, escalating a standoff with the French nuclear-power company.
item.dc:creator: Katarina Hoije

item.title: Cliff Asness Says Retail Push for Private Assets Is a ‘Terrible’ Idea
item.description: Welcome to ETF IQ, a weekly newsletter dedicated to the $14 trillion global ETF industry. I'm Bloomberg News reporter and anchor Katie Greifeld.
item.dc:creator: Katie Greifeld

item.title: IBM Announces Quantum Milestone
item.description: Jerry Chow, IBM Fellow and Director of Quantum Systems at IBM Research, explains the company’s latest milestone in its effort to build the world’s first fault-tolerant quantum computer. Chow speaks with Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Musk’s Tesla Prepares to Launch Robotaxi Service
item.description: As Tesla prepares to launch its robotaxi service in Austin, Kara Kockelman, Professor of Transportation Engineering at the University of Texas, discusses the cost savings that autonomous driving can bring to the roads. She joins Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)
